intro: Trichera arvensis var. integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf trichera, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows and along roadsides. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. The variety integrifolia is distinguished by its entire leaf margins, setting it apart from other varieties of Trichera arvensis.
